subject: Bicycles and Bicycling
Tests and Testing
Steroids
Freedom and Human Rights
lead_paragraph: Alexander Vinokourov has accused cycling authorities of violating human rights and vowed to clear his name after failing a doping test last month at the Tour de France.Vinokourov, 33, in his native Kazakhstan for the first time since his expulsion from the Tour, said riders were being subjected to doping controls beyond those of other sports.“In cycling, nobody respects human rights,” Vinokourov said.Vinokourov, a prerace favorite at the Tour, tested positive for doping after winning a time trial July 21. He was fired by his Astana team, which has been banned from next month’s Tour of Spain.
